      • setIncludeLimit

        public void setIncludeLimit(int theIncludeLimit)
        This is the maximum number of resources that will be added to a single page of returned resources. Because of includes with wildcards and other possibilities it is possible for a client to make requests that include very large amounts of data, so this hard limit can be imposed to prevent runaway requests.

      • setInterceptors

        public void setInterceptors(IServerInterceptor... theInterceptor)
        This may be used to optionally register server interceptors directly against the DAOs.

        Registering server action interceptors against the JPA DAOs can be more powerful than registering them against the RestfulServer, since the DAOs are able to break transactions into individual actions, and will account for match URLs (e.g. if a request contains an If-None-Match URL, the ID will be adjusted to account for the matching ID).

      • setInterceptors

        public void setInterceptors(List<IServerInterceptor> theInterceptors)
        This may be used to optionally register server interceptors directly against the DAOs.

        Registering server action interceptors against the JPA DAOs can be more powerful than registering them against the RestfulServer, since the DAOs are able to break transactions into individual actions, and will account for match URLs (e.g. if a request contains an If-None-Match URL, the ID will be adjusted to account for the matching ID).

      • setResourceEncoding

        public void setResourceEncoding(ResourceEncodingEnum theResourceEncoding)

      • setSchedulingDisabled

        public void setSchedulingDisabled(boolean theSchedulingDisabled)

      • setSubscriptionEnabled

        public void setSubscriptionEnabled(boolean theSubscriptionEnabled)
        Does this server support subscription? If set to true, the server will enable the subscription monitoring mode, which adds a bit of overhead. Note that if this is enabled, you must also include Spring task scanning to your XML config for the scheduled tasks used by the subscription module.

      • setSubscriptionPollDelay
